description.zh-cn: 日本战国时代末期至江户时代初期的武将、战国大名，江户幕府第一代征夷大将军。日本史上杰出的政治家和军事家。与织田信长、丰臣秀吉并称“战国三杰”。
description.en: A Japanese military commander and daimyo from the late Sengoku period to the early Edo period, and the first shogun of the Edo Shogunate. He was an outstanding politician and strategist in Japanese history, known as one of the 'Three Great Unifiers of Japan' along with Oda Nobunaga and Toyotomi Hideyoshi.

description.zh-cn: 日本战国时代武将，松平氏第8代当主，德川家康之父。
description.en: A Japanese samurai of the Sengoku period, the 8th head of the Matsudaira clan, and the father of Tokugawa Ieyasu.

description.zh-cn: 德川家康之母。
description.en: The mother of Tokugawa Ieyasu.

description.zh-cn: 日本战国时代至安土桃山时代的武将、大名，与丰臣秀吉、德川家康并称“战国三杰”。
description.en: A Japanese daimyō of the Sengoku and Azuchi–Momoyama periods. Known as one of the 'Three Great Unifiers of Japan' along with Toyotomi Hideyoshi and Tokugawa Ieyasu.

description.zh-cn: 日本战国时代至安土桃山时代的武将、大名，与织田信长、德川家康并称“战国三杰”。
description.en: A Japanese daimyō of the Sengoku and Azuchi–Momoyama periods. Known as one of the 'Three Great Unifiers of Japan' along with Oda Nobunaga and Tokugawa Ieyasu.

description.zh-cn: 日本战国时代骏河国的大名，德川家康早年的主君。
description.en: A daimyō of Suruga Province during the Sengoku period in Japan and the early lord of Tokugawa Ieyasu.

description.zh-cn: 由德川家康在日本江户（今东京）所创立的武家政权，统治日本二百六十余年。
description.en: A feudal military government of Japan established by Tokugawa Ieyasu in Edo (modern-day Tokyo), which ruled Japan for over 260 years.

description.zh-cn: 织田信长以少胜多，在桶狭间奇袭并击杀今川义元的著名战役，是德川家康独立的契机。
description.en: A famous battle in which Oda Nobunaga, with a much smaller force, launched a surprise attack and defeated Imagawa Yoshimoto. This event provided the opportunity for Tokugawa Ieyasu to become independent.

description.zh-cn: 德川家康与织田信长缔结的军事同盟，是战国时期维持时间最长的盟约之一。
description.en: A military alliance formed between Tokugawa Ieyasu and Oda Nobunaga, one of the longest-lasting alliances of the Sengoku period.

description.zh-cn: 明智光秀于京都本能寺发动兵变，包围并迫使织田信长自杀的事件。
description.en: An incident in which Akechi Mitsuhide launched a coup at Honnō-ji temple in Kyoto, surrounding and forcing Oda Nobunaga to commit suicide.

description.zh-cn: 日本战国时代的武将，织田信长的家臣，后发动本能寺之变。
description.en: A samurai general of the Sengoku period, a retainer of Oda Nobunaga, who later launched the Honnō-ji Incident.

description.zh-cn: 织田信长死后，羽柴秀吉与德川家康、织田信雄联军之间爆发的战役。
description.en: A battle fought between the forces of Hashiba Hideyoshi and the coalition of Tokugawa Ieyasu and Oda Nobukatsu after the death of Oda Nobunaga.

description.zh-cn: 决定天下归属的战役，德川家康率领的东军战胜石田三成率领的西军，为江户幕府的建立奠定了基础。
description.en: A decisive battle that determined the fate of Japan, where the Eastern Army led by Tokugawa Ieyasu defeated the Western Army led by Ishida Mitsunari, laying the foundation for the establishment of the Edo Shogunate.

description.zh-cn: 日本安土桃山时代的武将、大名，丰臣政权的五奉行之一，关原合战中西军的领导者。
description.en: A samurai commander and daimyō of the Azuchi-Momoyama period, one of the Five Commissioners of the Toyotomi administration, and the leader of the Western Army in the Battle of Sekigahara.

description.zh-cn: 江户幕府为消灭丰臣氏而发动的战争，分为冬之阵和夏之阵，最终导致丰臣氏灭亡。
description.en: A series of battles undertaken by the Edo Shogunate to destroy the Toyotomi clan, divided into the Winter and Summer campaigns, which ultimately led to the downfall of the Toyotomi clan.

description.zh-cn: 由丰臣秀吉建立的武家氏族，在丰臣秀吉死后由其子丰臣秀赖继承，最终被德川家康消灭。
description.en: A Japanese samurai clan founded by Toyotomi Hideyoshi. After his death, his son Toyotomi Hideyori succeeded him, but the clan was eventually destroyed by Tokugawa Ieyasu.

description.zh-cn: 日本第107代天皇，于1603年册封德川家康为征夷大将军。
description.en: The 107th Emperor of Japan, who appointed Tokugawa Ieyasu as Seii Taishōgun in 1603.

description.zh-cn: 日本古代的军事统帅官职，后成为武家政权的最高权力者称号。
description.en: A military commander title in ancient Japan, which later became the title for the supreme ruler of a samurai government.

description.zh-cn: 德川家康第三子，江户幕府第二代将军。
description.en: The third son of Tokugawa Ieyasu and the second shogun of the Edo Shogunate.

description.zh-cn: 日本第108代天皇，于1616年任命德川家康为太政大臣。
description.en: The 108th Emperor of Japan, who appointed Tokugawa Ieyasu as Daijō-daijin in 1616.

description.zh-cn: 日本古代律令制下的最高官职，为太政官之长。
description.en: The highest official post under the ancient Ritsuryō system of Japan, head of the Dajō-kan (Grand Council of State).

description.zh-cn: 丰臣秀吉之子及继承人，在大坂之役中被德川家康击败后自尽。
description.en: The son and designated successor of Toyotomi Hideyoshi, who committed suicide after being defeated by Tokugawa Ieyasu in the Siege of Osaka.

description.zh-cn: 德川家康是松平广忠的儿子。
description.en: Tokugawa Ieyasu is the son of Matsudaira Hirotada.

description.zh-cn: 德川家康是于大之方的儿子。
description.en: Tokugawa Ieyasu is the son of Odai no kata.

description.zh-cn: 德川家康早年作为人质侍奉今川义元，并接受其偏讳改名为松平元康。
description.en: In his early years, Tokugawa Ieyasu served Imagawa Yoshimoto as a hostage and adopted the name Matsudaira Motoyasu, receiving a character from Yoshimoto's name.

description.zh-cn: 织田信长在桶狭间之战中奇袭并击杀了今川义元。
description.en: Oda Nobunaga launched a surprise attack and killed Imagawa Yoshimoto in the Battle of Okehazama.

description.zh-cn: 德川家康与织田信长缔结了长达20年的清洲同盟，共同对抗敌人。
description.en: Tokugawa Ieyasu and Oda Nobunaga formed the 20-year Kiyosu Alliance to fight common enemies.

description.zh-cn: 织田信长在本能寺之变中身亡，导致清洲同盟瓦解。
description.en: The death of Oda Nobunaga in the Honnō-ji Incident led to the dissolution of the Kiyosu Alliance.

description.zh-cn: 明智光秀发动本能寺之变，背叛并导致了织田信长的死亡。
description.en: Akechi Mitsuhide launched the Honnō-ji Incident, betraying and causing the death of Oda Nobunaga.

description.zh-cn: 在小牧·长久手之战中，德川家康与丰臣秀吉对峙。
description.en: Tokugawa Ieyasu confronted Toyotomi Hideyoshi in the Battle of Komaki and Nagakute.

description.zh-cn: 小牧·长久手之战后，德川家康迫于形势向丰臣秀吉臣服。
description.en: After the Battle of Komaki and Nagakute, Tokugawa Ieyasu was forced by circumstances to submit to Toyotomi Hideyoshi.

description.zh-cn: 德川家康在关原合战中率领东军，与石田三成领导的西军作战并取得胜利。
description.en: Tokugawa Ieyasu led the Eastern Army to victory against the Western Army, led by Ishida Mitsunari, in the Battle of Sekigahara.

description.zh-cn: 石田三成在关原合战中战败，其势力被德川家康消灭。
description.en: Ishida Mitsunari was defeated in the Battle of Sekigahara, and his forces were eliminated by Tokugawa Ieyasu.

description.zh-cn: 德川家康在关原合战胜利后，于1603年在江户开创了幕府政权。
description.en: After his victory in the Battle of Sekigahara, Tokugawa Ieyasu founded the shogunate government in Edo in 1603.

description.zh-cn: 后阳成天皇于1603年下诏，册封德川家康为征夷大将军。
description.en: In 1603, Emperor Go-Yōzei issued an edict appointing Tokugawa Ieyasu as Seii Taishōgun.

description.zh-cn: 德川家康于1605年将将军之位传给其子德川秀忠，自己成为大御所。
description.en: In 1605, Tokugawa Ieyasu passed the title of shogun to his son, Tokugawa Hidetada, and became the Ōgosho (retired shogun).

description.zh-cn: 德川家康为消灭丰臣氏残余势力，发动了大坂冬之阵与夏之阵。
description.en: To eliminate the remaining forces of the Toyotomi clan, Tokugawa Ieyasu initiated the Winter and Summer campaigns of the Siege of Osaka.

description.zh-cn: 大坂之役最终导致丰臣氏彻底灭亡。
description.en: The Siege of Osaka ultimately led to the complete destruction of the Toyotomi clan.

description.zh-cn: 丰臣秀赖在大坂夏之阵战败后自尽。
description.en: Toyotomi Hideyori committed suicide after being defeated in the Summer Campaign of the Siege of Osaka.

description.zh-cn: 后水尾天皇于1616年任命德川家康为太政大臣。
description.en: Emperor Go-Mizunoo appointed Tokugawa Ieyasu as Daijō-daijin in 1616.

description.zh-cn: 德川秀忠是德川家康的第三子。
description.en: Tokugawa Hidetada is the third son of Tokugawa Ieyasu.

description.zh-cn: 丰臣秀赖是丰臣秀吉的儿子。
description.en: Toyotomi Hideyori is the son of Toyotomi Hideyoshi.
